content.description: Follow the bolt line to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts and a bolt anchor.
content.location: Right of Institution Green.

content.description: Start at the left end of a low roof and follow the bolt line to the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Far left (downstream) end of Sunkist wall where the trail comes back close to the wall.

content.description: This route is not listed in the Cater Guide, 3rd edition.  If you have any info, I'll add it to the description.   This is a very nice route!  Start by climbing up an overhanging face on good holds.  Diagonal up and left using some small holds to make a reach to a great horizontal ledge (crux).  Mantle up to reach a slabby face.   Make thin moves heading up and left to reach the anchors.   I expect this route to become popular once more people realize it's here, very nice!
content.protection: 5 bolts? Shuts.
content.location: This is the sport line just to the left of the Dead Varment crack.  Located on the far left side of the Sunkist wall where the road meets the cliff.

content.description: Start on the right and climb left to the ledge then have some fun and head up the crack as it works left and right.
content.protection: There are a new set of anchors at the top.
content.location: When the trail from the river meets the cliff, Turtle power will be right in front of you. To the left will be Country Love and to the right will be Hilly Billy.

content.description: Some really cool friction climbing at the bottom. Work the slopers under the seam as you arc to the left. After that, head on up with an interesting finish over the last bolt.
content.protection: Anchors shared at the top with Hilly Billy. Six bolts that has somewhat of a runout between the third and fourth. Consider placement or do it as a TR with a runner after you climb Hilly Billy.
content.location: About forty feet to the right of Hilly Billy.

content.description:
Stick clip first bolt. Pull roof using power and generous jugs near crack. Commence up face, staying to either side of crack. A nice handjam near the top is helpful...but also may summon the resident bat!

Jugs, edges, sidepulls, and a mid-way reach give the route variety.
content.protection: 5 bolts. Anchors.
content.location: Third bolted route from left end of main wall. Starts below 8 ft. roof. Follows obvious crack.

content.description: Another fantastic face climb.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 1 bolt anchor

content.description: Climb up the juggy face to the small alcove about 20 feet up. Place some gear and traverse up onto the ledge to the first bolt. Clip this and continue up the face to the top passing another bolt and gear placements.
content.protection: Two very bad bolts and standard rack. Posting this on here with the hopes that someone with a bolting rig will check it out and decide to replace the bolts...I got up to the first bolt and bailed because it did not look like it would be solid enough to hold a fall. The second bolt looked even worse.
content.location: Left of Moochie

content.description: A classic face climb with a little bit of everything.
content.protection: 6 bolts, bolt anchor.
content.location: On the far right of the Sunkist Wall

content.description: Climbs crack system using mostly face climbing technique. Crux near the top of the crack, then steps right up slightly overhanging jugs.  Excellent route that goes all the way to the top of the cliff.
content.protection:
Uses some thin gear: rps and small to medium cams.

Has new bolted anchors.  Thank you NRAC.
content.location: Begins at left end of the high roof near the upstream end of Sunkist wall.  Can start in the crack (harder) or just right.

content.description:
Yep, after the first series of moves,

The Jungle Book

might come to mind.

Stick clip, surmount roof, and move right to rest (you'll need it). Here, you can reflect and strategize. Up, tip-toe left, and proceed using a full repertoire of edges, sidepulls, and a pocket (or two). Slopers await those who advance directly to anchors. (The blunt arete to the left is also an option.)

A great route!
content.protection: 5 bolts. Anchors.
content.location: Left side of Sunkist Wall. First bolted route above an 8 ft. roof.

content.description: Climb up the seeping corner to the V-slot under the roof. Jam out the roof and make your way up the dirty and awkward crack to the top. This route is dirty from top to bottom, with a nice mud mantle top out. It also has some fairly burly climbing for 5.10a so expect an adventure!
content.protection: Double rack of cams and some long slings. There is no anchor, so use a tree or two to rap down from the top.
content.location: Starts in the obvious cave about 20 feet left of Pay the Mortgage.

content.description: The climbing is good, rock quality is all there the holds up high are increasingly tricky. The real crux is lower. This climbs like a sport route not a trad route.
content.protection: Three bolts to bolt anchor.
content.location: The route starts to the left of the V slot of Moochie and trends left to continue up the right line of bolts.

content.description: The crux is right after the first bolt.
content.protection: 5 bolts and a bolt anchor.
content.location: The leftmost sport route on the wall that follows a right-facing flake system.

content.description: There are a few moves in the beginning that can be a little reachy. Work through them and after you clip the last bolt, look to the left for a couple hidden crimps then top out to the anchor.
content.protection: 8 bolts to the anchor that is shared with Taxi Guacho
content.location: The trail from the river dumps you at Turtle Power (crack climb that starts on the ledge). Hilly Billy will be the first bolted line to the right of that.

content.description: This route is not a hand out for a 5.11b! Start by climbing up the overhanging section to reach a good ledge. From here, head straight up and a bit right to reach the 3rd bolt. Use small holds to make a long reach to a wide horizontal hold that's only really good in 1 or 2 spots (crux). Clip the 4th bolt and head a bit to the right to reach the top ledge above the shuts and clip them on your left. If you head straight up to the shuts from the 4th bolt, it's definitely not 5.11b.
content.protection: 4 bolts to new bolted anchors thanks to NRAC.
content.location: This route is located about 15 feet to the right of Soul Patch, 5.11a and about 20 feet to the left of the Arachniphobia, 5.9 corner crack.

content.description: Start Mr. Mogely. After the 2nd bolt veer right and go srtaight up the middle of the overhanging face. Easy crimping off of the no-hands leadge leads to to the crux at mid height. A single move from a sloping right hand crimp to a better, flat, left hand crimp. A few more easier moves on good holds leads back to the Mr. Mogely anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts, anchors
content.location: Between Mr. Mogely and Soul Patch

content.description: Interestingly enough, it smelled like something died near this route when we were climbing it but we never found the source of the smell.   Start out by climbing up to a small overhang to reach the hand crack.  Pull the small overhang using great jams to gain a stance (crux).  From here, follow the crack to the top on easier terrain.  There's great jugs and great stopper placements to the end.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Gear and stoppers to 2".  Shuts.
content.location: As you approach the Sunkist wall, continue past the trail on the right that leads to the majority of the climbs.  This is the obvious crack line that starts on the side of the road, just to the right of a sport route(sport route not listed in Cater Guide, 3rd edition).

content.description: This short bolted line starts right at the road/trail.
content.protection: Four bolts, 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: To the left of Dead Varmint where the road and trail intersect.

content.description: Perfect movement with barely enough holds! Begin with easy climbing to a rest. Move out right just above the roof and tackle the first tough crux. Catch another small rest before tackling the wave arete. Once standing above the arete the climb is not over. A thought provoking slab section on the upper white face protects the final jug section to the anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts.  Bolted anchor.
content.location: Beautiful blunt arete that you can't miss when at Sunkist wall

content.description: A short stretch of an acute corner takes you to a straight in finger crack. Then a juggy face to the roof. Exit to your right to the tree belay.
content.protection: Standard Rack to 2”. Nice new two-bolt anchor.
content.location: To the left of Nominative.

content.description:
Cruxes are back to back about 3/4 up the wall.

Impressive if this was an on sight first ascent.
content.protection: Small to medium cams and tri-cams.  May use small nuts.  Has new, bolted anchors thanks to NRAC.
content.location: Starts at Arachnophobia, then moves left up small corner.

content.description: If you can climb trad at this grade, this one's worth the walk.   Start at the overhang directly below the obvious finger crack splitting the upper face.  Campus up a move or two, making some committing moves to reach a stance on the face.  (no gear for the first 20 feet or so).  Place some gear and follow a short hand crack and jugs to reach a great stance in a pod with great hand jams.  Sew it up, the business starts here.  Work your way up a tips crack with a few difficult finger locks to reach a money lock and then a great horizontal (crux).  From here, the difficulty backs down as you follow a tight hands crack with an occasional face hold to the top.   (As of 7/09, there were no fixed anchors but a single bomber fixed nut can be used to lower off).
content.protection: Mostly small cams and nuts (< 1").  A #3 camalot can be placed in the pod below the crux.
content.location: Once you reach the Sunkist Wall, follow the trail to the right side of the cliff.  The crack will be obvious.

content.description:
A fun dihedral crack route! (...and, a rare Meadow River moderate.)

Stem, jam, layback, occasional holds.
content.protection:
Standard rack, mostly hand size cams.

New bolted anchors with rap rings.
content.location: Obvious dihedral mid-left on Sunkist Wall.
